metadata.title: RX Family: How to update the firmware

sections.content:
Question:
Are there any application notes or sample code that I can refer to in order to update the firmware?
Answer:
The following are available. Please refer to them according to your application.
(No sample code below)
This document explains general concepts and design policies for firmware updates.
[Renesas MCU Firmware Update Design Policy (R01AN5548)]
This document explains general design guide for firmware updates via OTA.
[RX65N Group AWS FreeRTOS 2nd MCU OTA Firmware Update Design Guide (R01AN6361)]
This is a guide to the concept and use of dual mode. It mainly explains how to debug and how to write with Renesas Flash Programmer.
[Dual Mode Usage Guide (R01AN6894)]
(Sample code available below)
This FIT performs firmware updates via a communication interface. It has a secure boot function and supports firmware updates in linear mode and dual mode.
[RX Family Firmware Update Module Using Firmware Integration Technology (R01AN6850)]
[sample code (R01AN6850)]
Firmware is updated via data communication (Full-speed transfer) with USB host using CDC (Communication Device Class).
[RX Family Internal Flash ROM rewrite program via USB CDC (R01AN3294)]
[sample code (R01AN3294)]
Firmware is updated from user program (mot file) in USB memory via USB (Mass Storage Class).
[RX Family Internal Flash ROM rewrite program via USB Mass Storage (R01AN3503)]
[sample code (R01AN3503)]
Firmware is updated by FreeRTOS OTA using Amazon Web Services. The e2 studio allows you to download sample projects from GitHub.
[RX Family How to implement FreeRTOS OTA using Amazon Web Services in RX65N (for v202210.01-LTS-rx-1.1.3 or later) (R01AN7037)]
Firmware is updated using the Startup Program Protection feature on the RX100/RX200 series.
[RX100/RX200 Series Updating Firmware Using Start-Up Program Protection and Serial Communication (R01AN3740)]
[sample code (R01AN3740)]
Suitable Products
RX Family
